{"step_by_step_thinking": "The skull of a newborn has several unique features. A. Diploe, the spongy bone between the inner and outer layers of the cranial bones, is not yet formed in a newborn. B. The styloid process, a thin, pointed piece of bone that extends from the base of the temporal bone, has not yet fused with the rest of the temporal bone in a newborn. C. The anterior fontanelle, a soft spot on a baby's head, is open in a newborn. D. The mastoid process, a bony prominence located behind the ear, is not of adult size in a newborn. It grows and develops as the child grows.", "answer_choice": "D"}
